body_html:
I am using tf.estimator (model_dir points to hadoop), but I think you simply need to set the directory of your FileWriter to a hdfs path, e.g.

tf.summary.FileWriter('hdfs://url_of_your_namenode:8020/any_directory', graph_def=sess.graph_def)

Just be sure to follow all the stops from the documentation. Some hadoop namenodes also may be reachable through port 9000.
body_text:
I am using tf.estimator (model_dir points to hadoop), but I think you simply need to set the directory of your FileWriter to a hdfs path, e.g.
tf.summary.FileWriter('hdfs://url_of_your_namenode:8020/any_directory', graph_def=sess.graph_def)
Just be sure to follow all the stops from the documentation. Some hadoop namenodes also may be reachable through port 9000.
body:
I am using `tf.estimator` (model_dir points to hadoop), but I think you simply need to set the directory of your `FileWriter` to a hdfs path, e.g.

```python
tf.summary.FileWriter('hdfs://url_of_your_namenode:8020/any_directory', graph_def=sess.graph_def)
```

Just be sure to follow all the stops from the documentation. Some hadoop namenodes also may be reachable through port 9000.
